content: By Ross Kerber     BOSTON  Nov 9 Mutual fund Sequoia's loss on Valeant Pharmaceuticals International underscores the danger of placing a big bet on an individual stock. But while Sequoia is an extreme example  it is not the only mutual fund doing it.     Some 13 other domestic U.S. equity funds that manage more than $1 billion in assets have placed 10 percent or more of their portfolio in a single company  according to data from Thomson Reuters' Lipper unit  with three of them holdin
name: DISH Network Corporation
title: Valeant meltdown puts spotlight on big mutual fund bets

title: LightSquared plan to repay Dish chairman goes before U.S. judge
